Quick search

Installing¶

Requirements¶

Python version >= 3.7

../../../requirements.txt¶
matplotlib
numpy < 1.23
numba
netcdf4
setuptools
pyproj
python-dateutil
psutil
scipy
pyyaml

Linux¶

Notes: may need to install

  • git

  • python3 pip

  • pip eg sudo apt install python3-pip

  • python3-venv, eg sudo apt install python3.10-venv

before this, eg sudo apt install python3-pip

  1. Clone repository

    git clone https://github.com/oceantracker/oceantracker.git

  2. Working in a Virtual environment

    Change dir to repository dir eg. oceantracker

  3. Create virtual environment

    python3 -m venv venv

  4. Activate venv

    source ./venv/bin/activate

  5. Install packages in venv

    python setup.py develop

    pip install -r ./requirements.txt

  6. Test by running a demo

    cd ./demos

    python run_demos.py -n --d 2

  7. Deactivate environment

    deactivate

or use command bash linux_install.sh with script found in install folder

../../../installing/linux_install.sh¶
# install ocean tracker
# run from inside dir where install required

rm oceantracker -rf # replacing any existing package

git clone https://github.com/oceantracker/oceantracker.git

cd ./oceantracker

python3 -m venv venv

source ./venv/bin/activate

python setup.py develop   # add package to path

pip install -r ./requirements.txt

# test by running demos
echo "Test run demo 60"
cd ./demos

python run_demos.py -n --d 2

python run_demos.py -n --d 56

cd ..

cd ..

Windows¶

To create a Conda virtual environment

  1. Install Anaconda, then

  2. From within folder/dir where oceantracker is to be installed, clone repository

    git clone https://github.com/oceantracker/oceantracker.git

  3. Open Andconda command prompt as administrator

  4. Create virtual environment

    conda env create --file environment.yml

  5. Activate virtual environment

    conda activate oceantracker

  6. For Pycharm users,

    # oceantracker should be one of the available Python interpreters so just select it (if it sits within Anaconda3envs dir), # otherwise add virtual environment manually, settings/project/interpreter add conda env by navigating to python.exe on dir # if working in folder outside of ocean tracker will ad access with settings/project/project structure. add root source
